sourcing.instructions: Hg (Mercury): Obtain from chemical supply companies or specialized retailers. Tb (Terbium): Purchase from metal suppliers or rare earth material suppliers. Tl (Thallium): Source from chemical suppliers or specialty metal vendors. Ensure all materials comply with local regulations and safety standards.

1. In a well-ventilated fume hood, carefully measure 700 g of Hg using a glass or metal container. 2. Measure 600 g of Tb and add to the Hg container. 3. Measure 100 g of Tl and introduce it to the mixture. 4. Stir the mixture gently using a non-reactive rod until all components are uniformly blended.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a well-ventilated fume hood, carefully measure 700 g of Hg using a glass or metal container. 2. Measure 600 g of Tb and add to the Hg container. 3. Measure 100 g of Tl and introduce it to the mixture. 4. Stir the mixture gently using a non-reactive rod until all components are uniformly blended.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a heat-resistant crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a controlled environment to a temperature of 400°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete homogenization of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a heat-resistant crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a controlled environment to a temperature of 400°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete homogenization of the materials.

steps: 1. After heating, remove the crucible from the heat source. 2. Allow the crucible to cool to room temperature gradually, avoiding rapid cooling to prevent cracking. This should take approximately 2-3 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, remove the crucible from the heat source. 2. Allow the crucible to cool to room temperature gradually, avoiding rapid cooling to prevent cracking. This should take approximately 2-3 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect the surface for any irregularities. 3. If needed, sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with an appropriate coating if required for protection.
